item.title: Data Augmentation with Scikit-Image
item.description: According to the official site for scikit-image, "scikit-image is a collection of algorithms for image processing". As I learning about image processing, I seem to find more tutorials for OpenCV and Pillow rather than scikit-image, even though it comes pre-installed with several Python distributions. So here is my quick tutorial …

item.title: Pickling in Python!
item.description: Once you have been through EDA and built a satisfactory model with tuned hyperparameters, you are ready to predict using new values. However, you do not want to train your model every time you want to predict on new values. You just want to use the previously trained model and …

item.title: Classification Metrics II - F1 Score
item.description: Classification problems predict discrete values. In this post, we will be analyzing a classification metrics - F1 score, that uses harmonic mean as it's backbone. Before we start reading, please make sure that you understand terms like, False Positive, True Negative... Recall and Precision. If you need a refresher, check out …

item.title: Overfitting vs Underfitting - Looking for the sweet spot
item.description: Generalization is a machine learning concept that evaluates how a model performs on testing or unseen data. A model could score 99% accuracy on a training model, however if it cannot replicate the accuracy results then the model is useless. Our model could either underfit or overfit in these situations …

item.description:
